p: Perceptions of key informants are similar to about 58.1% ( n=186) of household questionnaire respondents who indicated that they were aware of climate change whilst 41.9% ( n=134) were not aware. Results from one-way ANOVA show that there were no significant differences in the mean responses across the entire sample ( p â‰¤ 0.000). Focus group discussions further revealed that, in the study area, rainfall has been generally decreasing whilst temperature has been increasing. Key informants and FGD participants expressed concern that while the rainfall amount has been generally decreasing, the seasonal distribution of the rainfall was not even throughout the growing seasons.
